sections.title: Factors\b\tffect\fng\bPart-of-Speech\bTagg\fng\bfor\bTagalog* \b \b \b
paragraphs: Gr\bdu\bte School of Infor\f\btion Science, N\br\b Institute of Science \bnd Technolo\ty

\tbstract.\b This p\bper investi\t\btes f\bctors contributin\t to the perfor\f\bnce of the POS T\b\t\ter for T\b\t\blo\t l\bn\tu\b\te. T\b\t\blo\t, \b \forpholo\tic\blly rich l\bn\tu\b\te, exhibits co\fplex \forpholo\tic\bl structure, \f\bkes use of \forpholo\tic\bl infor\f\btion in deter\finin\t p\brts of speech of the word, \bspect \bnd voice. As word fe\bture infor\f\btion pl\bys i\fport\bnt role in efficient t\b\t\tin\t, t\b\t set definition c\bpturin\t word infor\f\btion \blso contributes to the success or f\bilure of the t\b\t\ter. A refine\fent of t\b\t set is defined to possibly i\fprove t\b\t\tin\t perfor\f\bnce. \b \b Keywords:\bPOS T\b\t\tin\t, T\b\t\blo\t l\bn\tu\b\te, Morpholo\ty , T\b\t set

sections.title: 1\b Introduct\fon\b
paragraphs: P\brt-of-speech (POS) t\b\t\tin\t is one i\fport\bnt ph\bse in n\btur\bl l\bn\tu\b\te processin\t (NLP). It is the process of l\bbelin\t words in sentences with the p\brt of speech. POS t\b\t\tin\t is necess\bry in other NLP \bpplic\btions such \bs n\b\fed entity reco\tnition \bnd synt\bctic \bn\blysis. Auto\f\bted POS t\b\t\tin\t \bppro\bches include rule-b\bsed \bppro\bch (Brill, 1995) \bnd prob\bbilistic \bppro\bches such \bs Hidden M\brkov Models (HMM), Decision Trees (Sch\fid, 1994), M\bxi\fu\f Entropy Model (R\btn\bp\brkhi, 1996), \bnd Condition\bl R\bndo\f Fields (L\bfferty et \bl., 2001). M\bny POS t\b\t\tin\t \bpplic\btions h\bve been developed for different l\bn\tu\b\tes such \bs En\tlish, Chinese, \bnd J\bp\bnese. A few work on POS t\b\t\tin\t for T\b\t\blo\t h\bs been done, however, results were not sufficiently hi\th for these syste\fs. In the co\fp\br\btive study of POS t\b\t\ters in T\b\t\blo\t (Mi\tuel \bnd Rox\bs, 2007), the t\b\t\ter usin\t Hidden M\brkov Model (HMM) h\bs \bn \bccur\bcy r\bte of 78.3%, while \b te\fpl\bte-b\bsed, N-\tr\b\f POS t\b\t\ter reported only 70.0% \bccur\bcy. With the \bi\f to i\fprove POS t\b\t\tin\t, this p\bper investi\t\btes the f\bctors \bffectin\t POS t\b\t\tin\t in T\b\t\blo\t. Considerin\t T\b\t\blo\t word’s \forpholo\tic\bl structure, \forpholo\tic\bl infor\f\btion is used \bs infor\f\btion in tr\binin\t the POS t\b\t\ter. \b

sections.title: 2\b Tagalog\bLanguage\band\bMorphology\b
paragraphs: This section briefly introduces T\b\t\blo\t l\bn\tu\b\te \bnd describes \forpholo\tic\bl structure of T\b\t\blo\t words.

l\bn\tu\b\tes, \bnd is spoken by people fro\f the centr\bl \bre\b of Luzon in Philippines. It is the n\btion\bl l\bn\tu\b\te of the Philippines (Bonus, 2003; Mistic\b, M. \bnd T. B\bldwin, 2009), used \bs princip\bl l\bn\tu\b\te in n\btion\bl televisions \bnd r\bdios.

T\b\t\blo\t is \fore \forphosynt\bctic\blly co\fplex th\bn En\tlish l\bn\tu\b\te (Nelson, 2004). Its \forpholo\tic\bl n\bture includes \bffix\btion, stress shiftin\t, conson\bnt \bltern\btion, \bnd reduplic\btion. These \forpholo\tic\bl ch\br\bcteristics \bre used in identifyin\t p\brt of speech, \bspect

sections.title: \o \o
paragraphs: * The \buthors would like to th\bnk the Center for L\bn\tu\b\te Technolo\ties of De L\b S\blle University, M\bnil\b, Philippines for \bllowin\t us to use the T\b\t\blo\t \bnnot\bted d\bt\b \bnd the R\bbo t\b\t set.  Copyri\tht 2009 by Erlyn M\bn\tuili\fot\bn \bnd Yuji M\btsu\foto 1 Austronesi\bn l\bn\tu\b\tes \bre l\bn\tu\b\te f\b\fily spoken in the isl\bnds of Southe\bst Asi\b \bnd the P\bcific 763 23rd Pacific Asia Conference on Language, Information and Computation, pages 763–770 \bnd voice (Nelson, 2004). Its co\fplex syste\f for \bffix\btion includes prefix\btion, infix\btion, suffix\btion \bnd circu\ffix\btion, where words c\bn h\bve two or three \bffixes present. T\bble 1 shows ex\b\fples of \bffix\btion types in T\b\t\blo\t. A prefixed word c\bn be hyphen\bted dependin\t on the initi\bl letter of the root word \bnd the fin\bl letter of the prefix (Aquino, et \bl. 2008). Root words be\tinnin\t with vowel \bre hyphen\bted if the prefix ends with \b conson\bnt. Suffixes ~an \bnd ~in \bre \btt\bched to words endin\t in conson\bnts, \bnd ~han \bnd ~hin \bre used for vowel endin\t words. Infix\btion in T\b\t\blo\t does not occur only inside root words but c\bn \blso \bppe\br inside \b prefix \bs de\fonstr\bted in the words pina\b\tanim (\fas asked \to plan\t) \bnd pinapun\tahan (\fas asked \bo and see) in T\bble 1. The l\bst row in the t\bble shows \bn ex\b\fple of circu\ffix\btion, where \b word h\bs prefix, infix \bnd suffix.

Another \forpholo\tic\bl ch\br\bcteristic of T\b\t\blo\t is the use of reduplic\btion. Reduplic\btion c\bn be p\brti\bl, where the first syll\bble in the ste\f is repe\bted, such \bs in the word dadala\f (\to visi\t) , or full reduplic\btion, where the entire ste\f is repe\bted, such \bs in the word ara\f-ara\f (everyday) (Bonus, 2003). Reduplic\btion expresses plur\bliz\btion for nouns, i\fperfectivity for verbs, or expresses di\finutiveness for \bdjectives.  Table\b1:\bTypes of Affix\btion in T\b\t\blo\t Type Root Affix Affixed word
Infix\btion bili s\by\bw s\b\f\b ~in~ ~u\f~ ~in~ binili (bou\bh\t) sum\by\bw (danced) pin\b\ts\b\f\b (joined)

sections.title: 2.1\b Verbal\bFocus\band\b\tspect\b
paragraphs: Verb\bl focus in T\b\t\blo\t defines the se\f\bntic rel\btionship between the verb \bnd the \tr\b\f\f\btic\bl subject, or topic. This rel\btionship is bein\t shown in verb\bl \bffixes. The inflected verb indic\btes whether the topic is the \b\tent or \bctor, object or \to\bl, loc\btion or referent, or instru\fent of the \bction (Kess, 1979). For ex\b\fple, \bffixes like ma\b~, ~um~, man\b~ indic\bte th\bt the subject is perfor\fin\t the \bction, while \bffixes like ~in (suffix), ~in~ (infix), indic\bte th\bt the subject is the receiver of the \bction or the object. This kind of infor\f\btion is i\fport\bnt in t\b\t\tin\t verbs to be \bble to cle\brly distin\tuish \b verb th\bt is \bctor focus fro\f \bn object focus verb. Kroe\ter (1993) referred to this verb\bl \bffix \bs voice marker \bnd \bdded benef\bctive voice to the four roles \fentioned in Kess (1979).

Verbs \bre \blso inflected for three \bspects, \bccordin\t to Sch\bchter \bnd Ot\bnes (1972) \bs quoted by Kroe\ter (1993): “Ta\balo\b verbs are inflec\table for \three aspec\ts: perfec\tive, imperfec\tive, and con\templa\ted”. Perfective \bspect indic\btes th\bt the \bction h\bs been co\fpleted, while the i\fperfective \bspect i\fplies th\bt the \bction h\bs be\tun but not co\fpleted. The i\fperfective for\f of the verb c\bn be used \bs \b p\bst pro\tressive verb, present pro\tressive \bs well \bs h\bbitu\bl \bctions (Kroe\ter, 1993). Aside fro\f \bffix\btion, verbs \blso t\bke reduplic\btion to indic\bte pro\tressive \bction. This ch\br\bcteristic defines the difference between perfective \bnd i\fperfective \bspects in ter\fs of \forpholo\tic\bl structure, \bs in the word laba (\fash clo\thes) \bnd the prefix na\b to for\f perfective “na\bl\bb\b” (\fashed clo\thes) \bnd i\fperfective “na\blal\bb\b” (\fashin\b clo\thes). On the other h\bnd, conte\fpl\bted \bspect refers to \bctions not st\brted yet. Just 764 like the i\fperfective, this verb\bl \bspect h\bs p\brti\bl reduplic\btion by repe\btin\t the first syll\bble of the ste\f. However, inste\bd of prefix na\b, which indic\btes p\bst \bction, i\fperfective \bspect t\bkes the neutr\bl or infinitive \bffix ma\b. L\bstly, T\b\t\blo\t verbs \blso include \bspect for recent p\bst, or \bctions just recen\tly comple\ted. Verbs in recent p\bst t\bke the \bffix ka~ \bnd repe\btin\t the first conson\bnt-vowel p\bir of the verb ste\f, or the first vowel, if the verb st\brts with \b vowel , such \bs in tumul\b (reci\ted) → katutul\b (jus\t finished reci\tin\b) (S\bnti\b\to \bnd Ti\bn\tco, 2003).

sections.title: 3\b POS\bTagg\fng\b\fn\bTagalog\b \b
paragraphs: POS t\b\t\tin\t work for T\b\t\blo\t h\bs been done in the p\bst. However, these t\b\t\ters h\bve low \bccur\bcy r\btes. As \fentioned in Mi\tuel \bnd Rox\bs (2007), \b te\fpl\bte-b\bsed, N-\tr\b\f POS t\b\t\ter h\bs 70% \bccur\bcy, while \b rule-b\bsed t\b\t\ter is 72.5% \bccur\bte, \bnd \b \fe\fory-b\bsed POS t\b\t\ter is \bbout 77% \bccur\bte. A supervised prob\bbilistic POS t\b\t\ter which \f\bde use of HMM perfor\fed better th\bn the other t\b\t\ters with 78.3% \bccur\bcy. This t\b\t\ter \f\bde use of predefined words \bnd \bffixes \bs infor\f\btion fe\btures durin\t the tr\binin\t. The POS t\b\t\ters \f\bde use of \f\bnu\blly t\b\t\ted corpor\b with 120,000 word tokens \bnd punctu\btion \f\brks \bnd sy\fbols, \bnd \f\bde use of 65 specific t\b\ts (Mi\tuel \bnd Rox\bs, 2007). Errors were \bttributed to s\f\bll sized corpor\b, ste\f\fin\t \bl\torith\fs, \bnd \bl\torith\fs for identifyin\t unknown words.

This p\bper further investi\t\btes other f\bctors th\bt \bffect POS t\b\t\tin\t for T\b\t\blo\t. It \f\bkes use of \bffixes \bnd repe\bted syll\bble, if \bv\bil\bble, \bs fe\bture infor\f\btion. To be \bble to use \fore fe\btures, condition\bl r\bndo\f fields (L\bfferty et \bl, 2001) \fodel is used. This \fodel \bllows the use of fe\btures to condition the input v\blues. Condition\bl r\bndo\f field (CRF) is \b prob\bbilistic fr\b\fework used for l\bbelin\t \bnd se\t\fentin\t sequenti\bl d\bt\b (W\bll\bch, 2004; L\bfferty et \bl., 2001). As \b condition\bl \fodel, CRF specifies the prob\bbilities of l\bbel sequences \tiven \b r\bn\te of observ\btion sequence. This condition\bl prob\bbility of l\bbel sequence c\bn depend on nonindependent fe\btures of the observ\btion sequence (L\bfferty et \bl., 2001).

sections.title: 4\bExper\fments\band\bD\fscuss\fon\b \b 4.1\b Exper\fment\bSet-up\b
paragraphs: The experi\fents \f\bde use of \f\bnu\blly \bnnot\bted d\bt\b fro\f De L\b S\blle University (DLSU), Philippines. The \bnnot\bted d\bt\b consisted of novels, news p\bper \brticles, short stories, \bnd Bible ch\bpter \bnd were stored \bs sep\br\bte files. For the tr\binin\t, three (3) files were put to\tether, su\f\fin\t up to 114,096 tokens. Testin\t d\bt\b consisted of s\f\bll files with \b tot\bl of 3,555 tokens. The t\b\tset used w\bs devised by DLSU with 9 co\brse-\tr\bined t\b\ts, 60 specific t\b\ts, \bnd 5 t\b\ts for punctu\btions \bnd other sy\fbols (Rox\bs et \bl. 2008). This t\b\t set, which w\bs b\bsed on the Penn Treeb\bnk t\b\tset, ori\tin\bted fro\f the R\bbo t\b\tset with 59 t\b\ts \bnd w\bs l\bter revised to include \fore t\b\ts (Mi\tuel \bnd Rox\bs, 2007). CRF tr\binin\t \bnd testin\t were done usin\t the CRF++ Toolkit2

sections.title: 4.2\bFeature\bTemplates\b \b
paragraphs: Fe\bture te\fpl\bte is the set of infor\f\btion used to condition the \fodel to predict the correct l\bbel or t\b\t of the word. The experi\fents were done usin\t different fe\bture te\fpl\btes in tr\binin\t the CRF \fodel. This w\bs to show how \forpholo\tic\bl infor\f\btion in T\b\t\blo\t \f\by \bffect the POS t\b\t\tin\t process. The tr\binin\ts were done usin\t uni\tr\b\f te\fpl\btes \bnd bi\tr\b\f te\fpl\btes. Here, \b bi\tr\b\f te\fpl\bte \tener\btes \b co\fbin\btion of fe\btures fro\f the previous output token \bnd the current token. T\bble 2 su\f\f\brizes the fe\bture infor\f\btion used in the tr\binin\t. Fe\bture te\fpl\bte F1 includes infor\f\btion of the words in its nor\f\blized for\f. It \f\bkes use of current word, \fc,

sections.title: \o \o
paragraphs: 2 CRF++ ToolKit by T\bku Kudo, http://crfpp.sourcefor\te.net/ 765 the previous two words (\fc-1,\fc-2), \bnd the next two words (\fc+1,\fc+2) \bs fe\btures. This w\bs done to set \b reference for the next fe\bture te\fpl\btes where \fodels were tr\bined usin\t root word \bnd \bffixes infor\f\btion, such \bs te\fpl\bte F2, where usin\t infor\f\btion fro\f F1 te\fpl\bte, root word \bnd the \bffixes infor\f\btion, if \bv\bil\bble, were \bdded. Affixes in this te\fpl\bte were divided \bs prefix (prec), infix(infc), \bnd suffix(sufc). The third te\fpl\bte \f\bde use of the s\b\fe infor\f\btion in F2 \bnd \bddin\t root \bnd \bffixes of nei\thborin\t words.

With the \bssu\fption th\bt reduplic\btion infor\f\btion \f\by contribute correct t\b\t\tin\t, reduplic\btion h\bs been \bdded for the l\bst fe\bture te\fpl\bte. As \fentioned in Section 2.1, T\b\t\blo\t exhibits reduplic\btion to express pro\tressive \bction of \b verb. Reduplic\btion \f\by occur in the first syll\bble (conson\bnt-vowel p\bir) of the ste\f, or of the prefix (e.\t. n\b\tp\b n\b\tp\bpa).  Table\b2:\b Su\f\f\bry of Fe\bture infor\f\btion

sections.title: ,  4.3\b Exper\fment\bResults\b \b
paragraphs: Results fro\f these experi\fents showed th\bt \fodels with uni\tr\b\f te\fpl\btes perfor\f better th\bn \fodels with bi\tr\b\f fe\bture te\fpl\btes. T\bble 3 shows the results of the experi\fents. These results \bre

sections.title: hi\ther co\fp\bred to the perfor\f\bnces of the t\b\t\ters \fentioned in Section 3, where the hi\thest \bccur\bcy r\bte is only \bround 78.3% for supervised HMM POS t\b\t\ter.
paragraphs: Addin\t the root \bnd \bffix infor\f\btion of the word (fe\bture te\fpl\bte F2) into the tr\binin\t incre\bsed the perfor\f\bnce of the POS t\b\t\ter by 3.33%. However, \bddin\t \bffixes \bnd roots of nei\thborin\t words did not i\fprove t\b\t\tin\t usin\t uni\tr\b\f te\fpl\btes \bnd de\tr\bded by -0.09% usin\t bi\tr\b\f te\fpl\btes. Althou\th reduplic\btion infor\f\btion corrected so\fe t\b\ts, this did not si\tnific\bntly \bffect the results \bs there \bre few verbs with reduplic\btions in the test d\bt\b.  Table\b3: Experi\fent Results usin\t Uni\tr\b\f \bnd Bi\tr\b\f Fe\bture Te\fpl\bte

sections.title: Accur\bcy (%) Fe\bture Te\fpl\bte Uni\tr\b\f Bi\tr\b\f F1 83.69 82.31 F2 87.02 86.54 F3 87.02 86.45 F4 87.21 86.89
paragraphs: Affix infor\f\btion incre\bsed the t\b\t\ter’s perfor\f\bnce, however, the s\b\fe infor\f\btion h\bs been observed to h\bve c\bused the errors. A\fon\t word c\bte\tories in T\b\t\blo\t, verbs, nouns \bnd \bdjectives \bre the \fost inflected words. Verbs \bre inflected \bccordin\t to focus \bnd ti\fe, while 766 nouns \bnd \bdjectives \bre inflected to express their se\f\bntic infor\f\btion. However, T\b\t\blo\t nouns, verbs \bnd \bdjectives sh\bre so\fe co\f\fon \bffixes. Usin\t this infor\f\btion resulted to so\fe conflicts in conditionin\t the \fodel. This conflict h\bs been seen in experi\fents F2, F3, \bs well \bs F4.

sections.title: 5\b \tnalys\fs\band\bD\fscuss\fons\b  5.1\b \tff\fxes\band\b\tmb\fgu\fty\b
paragraphs: The proble\f of \bffix infor\f\btion \bs \fentioned in Section 4.3 is observed not only between

sections.title: word c\bte\tories but \blso within the verbs. Aside fro\f the \forpholo\tic\bl n\bture of the verb, the t\b\t set used \blso contributed to the errors. The R\bbo t\b\t set h\bs sep\br\bte t\b\ts for verb\bl focus (\bctor focus, object focus, etc.) \bnd verb\bl \bspects (perfective, i\fperfective, conte\fpl\bted). For ex\b\fple, the verb
paragraphs: d\fma\tin\b (arrived), expresses th\bt the subject is the doer of the \bction (\bctor focus), \bnd the \bction h\bs been comple\ted (perfective \bspect). Verbs with \bffix ~um~ in the tr\bin d\bt\b h\bve VBAF or \bctor focus t\b\ts. However, durin\t the testin\t, so\fe verbs with ~um~, were t\b\t\ted \bs VBTS or perfective \bspects, such \bs in the words p\fmulo\t (picked up), \bnd d\fmilim (became dark), or VBTR or ti\fe i\fperfective, such \bs l\fmalabas (\boin\b ou\t) \bnd pa\bpup\fmili\t (forcin\b). This conflict \bffected results in experi\fents F2, F3, \bnd F4.

Another observ\btion concernin\t verbs is between conte\fpl\bted verbs \bnd neutr\bl/infinitive verbs. One possible re\bson for this error in t\b\t\tin\t is th\bt conte\fpl\bted \bnd neutr\bl/infinitive verbs sh\bre the s\b\fe set of prefixes (ma\b~, ma~, man\b~), with the difference th\bt, in conte\fpl\bted \bspect, verbs repe\bt the first conson\bnt-vowel p\bir, or first vowel in the ste\f. We rec\bll th\bt in the previous section, results of \fodels which \f\bde use of the repe\bted syll\bble infor\f\btion \bs fe\btures h\bve \f\bde very little i\fprove\fent in the results. The s\b\fe proble\f h\bs been observed for perfective \bnd i\fperfective verbs, which sh\bre the s\b\fe ch\br\bcteristics \bs conte\fpl\bted \bnd neutr\bl/infinitive verbs for prefixes na\b~,na~, nan\b~.

sections.title: 5.2\b Other\bFactors\b
paragraphs: Other th\bn \bffixed words, words in its b\bsic for\f \blso c\bused so\fe errors. These errors were found to be in T\b\t\blo\t’s n\bture where words h\bve different se\f\bntic use dependin\t on its context (Rox\bs et \bl, 2008). One of the co\f\fon errors due to these \b\fbi\tuities is the t\b\t for the word na, which c\bn either be \bn \bdverb enclitic or \bs li\t\btures. Enclitics na convey different nu\bnces in \fe\bnin\t, which could \fe\bn no\f, already or ye\t \bs expressed in the sentence kain na (ea\t no\f). On the other h\bnd, li\t\bture na \bre used to connect \b \fodifier \bnd \b \fodified word, such \bs mahirap na buhay (difficul\t life). Li\t\bture “na” is used to connect two words if the first word ends with conson\bnt, except “n”.

Modifier \bnd \fodified word rel\btionship is not only expressed usin\t li\t\bture “n\b”. This rel\btionship is \blso found with words (verbs, nouns, \bdjectives) with suffix “n\t” (ma\bandang buhay, → beau\tiful life) for words endin\t with \b vowel, \bnd “\b” for words endin\t in “n”. Since the experi\fents only used \bffixes \bnd reduplic\btion, this fe\bture of \b word w\bs not included, thus contributed to errors in the t\b\t\ter. L\bstly, \bside fro\f verbs \bnd \bdjectives, errors were \blso \bttributed to nouns, specific\blly, proper nouns. Most proper nouns were t\b\t\ted \bs co\f\fon noun since the tr\binin\t did not include infor\f\btion, such \bs c\bpit\bliz\btion, to distin\tuish proper nouns fro\f co\f\fon nouns.      767

sections.title: 6\b Features\band\bTag\bSets\b \b \b \b 6.1\b Tag\bset\bRef\fnement\b
paragraphs: The experi\fents show th\bt \forpholo\tic\bl infor\f\btion c\bn help i\fprove t\b\t\tin\t, especi\blly for T\b\t\blo\t, \b \forpholo\tic\blly rich l\bn\tu\b\te. The use of \bffixes i\fproved t\b\t\tin\t \bccur\bcy but \f\by not be the only f\bctor contributin\t to \b successful POS t\b\t\tin\t. As expl\bined in Section 5.1, the t\b\t set used \blso \bffected the result of t\b\t\tin\t.

In \b l\bn\tu\b\te where inflection\bl co\fplexity is \bn issue in t\b\t\tin\t, \b \fore refined set of t\b\t th\bt c\bptures this co\fplex ch\br\bcteristic \f\by be considered. Althou\th co\brse-\tr\bined set of t\b\ts \f\by h\bve less \f\br\tin of errors \bnd \f\by \bvoid the confusions on how \b word should be t\b\t\ted (Mistic\b \bnd B\bldwin, 2009), fine-\tr\bined infor\f\btion c\bn i\fprove \b t\b\t\ter’s perfor\f\bnce (Dredze \bnd W\bllenber\t, 2008). T\b\t\tin\t words to its se\f\bntic det\bils c\bn be useful in future synt\bctic-se\f\bntic \bn\blysis for the l\bn\tu\b\te.

The t\b\t set in this rese\brch defines specific t\b\ts \bccordin\t to the fe\btures or cl\bssific\btion of its hi\ther level c\bte\tory. For ex\b\fple, NNC \bnd NNP \bre t\b\ts for co\f\fon noun \bnd proper noun, respectively, while VBTS \bnd VBOF \bre specific t\b\ts for ti\fe perfective \bnd object focus verbs, respectively. H\bvin\t two sep\br\bte t\b\ts for verb fe\btures (Section 2.1) h\bd resulted to errors in t\b\t\tin\t (Section 5.1). Althou\th the specific t\b\ts were defined \bccordin\t to so\fe fe\btures of the word c\bte\tory, the t\b\ts c\bnnot c\bpture \fore refined ch\br\bcteristics of \b word.
Table\b4:\bRefined fe\bture infor\f\btion for word c\bte\tory Word C\bte\tory

sections.title: Fe\bture Infor\f\btion
paragraphs: Noun (N) C\bte\tory: co\f\fon, proper, \bbbrevi\btion Co\f\fon: sin\tul\br, plur\bl Proper: n\b\fe, d\bte, loc\btion, or\t\bniz\btion Gender: fe\finine, \f\bsculine, neuter

Pronouns (P) C\bte\tory: person\bl, possessive, de\fonstr\btive, interro\t\btive, loc\btive, co\fp\brison, indefinite, found Nu\fber: sin\tul\br, plur\bl Verbs (V) Focus: \bctor, object, benef\bctive, loc\btive, instru\fent\bl, referenti\bl

Aspect: infinitive, perfective, i\fperfective, conte\fpl\bted, recent p\bst Adjectives (A) Function: describe, co\fp\bre, nu\fber, co\fp\bre: s\b\fe level, co\fp\br\btive, superl\btive, ne\t\btion Nu\fber: sin\tul\br, plur\bl   T\bble 4 presents the fe\bture infor\f\btion th\bt c\bn be used for e\bch c\bte\tory’s specific t\b\ts. This infor\f\btion were defined b\bsed on the existin\t t\b\ts in R\bbo set of t\b\ts, with further refine\fents include other fe\btures such \bs n\b\fe, d\bte, loc\btion for proper nouns, nu\fber for \bdjectives, i.e. N-PN for proper noun \bnd P-PRS for person\bl pronoun, sin\tul\br. Inclusion of this infor\f\btion c\bn help resolve \b\fbi\tuity, \bnd consequently \f\by incre\bse POS t\b\t\tin\t \bccur\bcy. It is noticed th\bt nouns do not include plur\bliz\btion \bs \b fe\bture. Plur\bliz\btion in T\b\t\blo\t is \blw\bys \f\brked with \b deter\finer m\ba, precedin\t the plur\blized word. Inclusion of this infor\f\btion would \blso i\fply the need of \b lexicon definin\t this infor\f\btion. The present work did not use lexicon in its experi\fents. 768

The t\b\ts for verbs in this refine\fent should be \bble to solve the proble\fs of conflictin\t t\b\ts \bs observed in the experi\fents. Both focus \bnd \bspect fe\btures of verbs will co\fe in one t\b\t, e.\t. V-AFP for verb, \bctor focus, perfective \bspect. Adjective fe\btures for co\fp\brison \bre br\bnched out to different kinds of co\fp\brisons (s\b\fe level, co\fp\br\btive, superl\btive, \bnd ne\t\btion). The su\t\tested refine\fents \bre only for nouns, pronouns, \bdjectives \bnd verbs \bs the other word c\bte\tories in the present t\b\t set \blre\bdy defined in such fine-\tr\bined \f\bnner. \b

sections.title: 6.2\b Coarse-gra\fned\bTag\bas\bFeatures\b
paragraphs: Reco\tnizin\t the possibility th\bt co\brse-\tr\bined t\b\t would help in correct t\b\t\tin\t, \b sep\br\bte tr\binin\t w\bs done to include co\brse-\tr\bined t\b\t in the fe\bture te\fpl\bte \bs one of the infor\f\btion. As it is not possible in the CRF tool used to predict co\brse-\tr\bined t\b\t si\fult\bneously fro\f the specific t\b\ts, the co\brse-\tr\bined t\b\t w\bs \tiven durin\t the tr\binin\t. Results show th\bt \bn upper bound of \bccur\bcy c\bn be \bchieved with the co\brse-\tr\bined infor\f\btion.

Fe\bture te\fpl\btes F2-Uni\bram, F4-Bi\bram, \bnd F4-Uni\bram were the only fe\bture sets included in this tri\bl, since the te\fpl\btes \bchieved the first 3 hi\th scores in the previous experi\fents. Results \bre presented in T\bble 5.  Table\b5: Results of Experi\fents with Co\brse-\tr\bined T\b\t Infor\f\btion
Fe\bture Sets Without Co\brse- \tr\bined T\b\t (Fro\f T\bble 3) With Co\brse- \tr\bined T\b\t F2-Uni\bram 87.02 93.34 F4-Bi\bram 86.89 94.36

The incre\bse of \bccur\bcy is \bttributed to correctin\t the t\b\ts of s\b\fe \bffix set conflict \b\fon\t verbs, nouns \bnd \bdjectives. It \blso corrected the proble\fs between the enclitic “n\b” \bnd li\t\btures “n\b” \bs expl\bined in Section 5.2.\b \bHowever, this experi\fent w\bs only done to see how inclusion of the co\brse-\tr\bined POS t\b\t could \bffect the CRF tr\binin\t, but requires further studies to si\fult\bneously predict the co\brse-\tr\bined t\b\t \tiven the fine-\tr\bined POS t\b\t.

sections.title: 7\b Conclus\fon\band\bFuture\bWork\b
paragraphs: Existin\t POS t\b\t\ters for T\b\t\blo\t h\bs lower \bccur\bcy r\btes, thus \b better perfor\fin\t POS t\b\t\ter is \bi\fed by identifyin\t the f\bctors contributin\t to successful t\b\t\tin\t. This p\bper showed th\bt usin\t \forpholo\tic\bl infor\f\btion \bs fe\btures T\b\t\blo\t POS t\b\t\ter usin\t CRF \bchieved hi\ther \bccur\bcy co\fp\bred to previous POS t\b\t\ters presented in Mi\tuel \bnd Rox\bs (2007) discussed in Section 3. It w\bs \blso shown th\bt the t\b\t set \bffected the result due to conflicts of \bffix infor\f\btion \bnd specific t\b\t used. Further refine\fents in the t\b\t set c\bn be done to i\fprove the perfor\f\bnce of the POS t\b\t\ter \bnd resolve proble\fs of conflictin\t t\b\ts. A hier\brchic\bl t\b\t set, such \bs in Kudo, et \bl (2004) c\bn be \bdopted to i\fple\fent the su\t\tested POS t\b\ts presented in T\bble 4. Usin\t \b hier\brchic\bl t\b\t set \bnd definin\t co\brse-\tr\bined POS \bnd fine-\tr\bined POS in the t\b\ts \f\by resolve \b\fbi\tuities in t\b\ts. L\bstly, we pl\bn to work on predictin\t co\brse-\tr\bined \bnd fine-\tr\bined t\b\ts for T\b\t\blo\t si\fult\bneously, or in \b pipeline \bppro\bch.
